page.title: 06NORTH RONALDSAY'S CREELING
page.content: Fishing for shellfish is carried out round the island.The fishing season usually begins in late May or early June,and depending on weather conditions,can last up until November or even into December.Approximately 100 creels are worked by each of the two lobster boats. The fishing during the summer season is mainly carried out on the North side of the island. This area extends from the afters of Linnay to Dennis Taing.Towards the end of September the creels are shifted to the East side,which cover from Dennis Taing to the point of Twingness including the Reef dyke.Each boat has two of a crew and each man has his own colour of bouyhead.The creels are set singly and usually have about 20 fathom of close corked rope.It takes from 5_6,hours to complete the days with the best creeling.
